docs.abstract: The country has become the world’s most populous, but there are doubts about whether that title heralds a growth in wealth and influence.
docs.snippet: The country has become the world’s most populous, but there are doubts about whether that title heralds a growth in wealth and influence.
docs.lead_paragraph: This month, India reached a notable milestone. The country’s population surpassed that of China, which had held the No. 1 position for at least three centuries.

headline.main: Can India Become the Next Global Superpower?

byline.original: By Sabrina Tavernise, Asthaa Chaturvedi, Alex Stern, Stella Tan, Rob Szypko, Paige Cowett, Marion Lozano, Elisheba Ittoop and Chris Wood

docs.abstract: A reversal in Australian immigration policy toward New Zealand is part of a reset in relations, but some tensions remain.
docs.snippet: A reversal in Australian immigration policy toward New Zealand is part of a reset in relations, but some tensions remain.
docs.lead_paragraph: The swearing-in ceremony had an unusual guest. Hundreds of New Zealanders were about to take an oath to become Australian citizens, and cheering them on in their pursuit of dual citizenship was the head of the New Zealand government.

headline.main: ‘Best Friends’ Australia and New Zealand Patch Up a Major Difference

docs.abstract: The Museum of the City of New York is preparing to take visitors on a trip down its own version of Memory Lane.
docs.snippet: The Museum of the City of New York is preparing to take visitors on a trip down its own version of Memory Lane.
docs.lead_paragraph: You know that life in the Big Apple has changed in the last 100 years. But when was the last time you stopped to think about just how much? Or in some cases, just how little?

headline.main: In 100 Years in New York City, So Much Has Changed, and Yet …

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Museum of the City of New York

docs.abstract: Heidi Dillon is on the vanguard of the fast-growing nonalcoholic-drinks sector and is reshaping how the male-dominated spirits industry perceives the shifting landscape.
docs.snippet: Heidi Dillon is on the vanguard of the fast-growing nonalcoholic-drinks sector and is reshaping how the male-dominated spirits industry perceives the shifting landscape.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Transforming Spaces” is a series about women driving change in sometimes unexpected places.

headline.main: As Interest in Wellness Stirs Up the Cocktail World, This Executive Gets Her Shot

docs.abstract: With a renowned collection of modern and contemporary art, the Buffalo AKG Art Museum has taken local concerns to heart in a $230 million transformation.
docs.snippet: With a renowned collection of modern and contemporary art, the Buffalo AKG Art Museum has taken local concerns to heart in a $230 million transformation.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUFFALO — After three and a half years and $230 million, a transformed museum here is about to open amid hopes that it will meet the expectations of a population far different from the one that greeted the original more than 160 years ago.

headline.main: Buffalo Remakes its Museum in its Own Image

docs.abstract: Judith Joy Ross, who has been taking portraits for decades, is the subject of a large retrospective at the Philadelphia Museum of Art.
docs.snippet: Judith Joy Ross, who has been taking portraits for decades, is the subject of a large retrospective at the Philadelphia Museum of Art.
docs.lead_paragraph: BETHLEHEM, Pa. — To hear the photographer Judith Joy Ross tell it, her life and career are riddled with nonstarters.

headline.main: A Photographer Whose Subject Is Everyday Life

docs.abstract: Institutions around the United States are offering more interactive learning to a broader age group, including practices that address mental health.
docs.snippet: Institutions around the United States are offering more interactive learning to a broader age group, including practices that address mental health.
docs.lead_paragraph: Connor Carey, 15, a sophomore at Fort Lauderdale High School in Florida, has a reading disability known as dyslexia. When he started as an Everglades EcoExplorers intern last summer, he said, he didn’t have a lot of self-confidence or social skills. A job with the Museum of Discovery and Science, a children’s institution in downtown Fort Lauderdale, gave him the opportunity to gain both.

headline.main: Children’s Museums Are Growing Intellectually and Emotionally

docs.abstract: Judy Blume’s coming-of-age story finally hits the big screen this month. The book will always have a spotlight of its own.
docs.snippet: Judy Blume’s coming-of-age story finally hits the big screen this month. The book will always have a spotlight of its own.
docs.lead_paragraph: When I arrived at the Crosby Street Hotel for a screening of “Are You There, God? It’s Me, Margaret?,” a man in the lobby located my name on a list, then directed me to a line for the coat check. I heard the crowd before I saw it.

headline.main: Why ‘Are You There, God? It’s Me, Margaret’ Still Matters

docs.abstract: This year, art exhibitions explore the Parisian suburbs, Pacific islands, grand Indian palaces and more through paintings, photography, sculpture and sketches.
docs.snippet: This year, art exhibitions explore the Parisian suburbs, Pacific islands, grand Indian palaces and more through paintings, photography, sculpture and sketches.
docs.lead_paragraph: Around the country this spring and summer, museums are aiming to transport visitors to the palaces of Udaipur, the Maya civilization, France during the Industrial Revolution, Japanese landscapes and the diverse communities of Queens — all for the price of an admission ticket.

headline.main: At These American Museums, You Can Travel the World

docs.abstract: Eduard Habsburg, Viktor Orban’s man at the Vatican, took the post after a career as a zombie movie screenwriter, novelist and cartoon producer. “I can get along with anybody,” says the descendant of emperors.
docs.snippet: Eduard Habsburg, Viktor Orban’s man at the Vatican, took the post after a career as a zombie movie screenwriter, novelist and cartoon producer. “I can get along with anybody,” says the descendant of emperors.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Pope Francis lands in Budapest on Friday, Eduard Habsburg, Hungary’s ambassador to the Holy See and a descendant of the defunct Habsburg dynasty that once ruled much of Europe, will greet him on the tarmac with a gift.

headline.main: Hungary’s Habsburg Ambassador to the Pope, With an Offbeat Résumé
